intro: Gnaphalium spadiceum, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green flower heads that resemble small cones. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Gnaphalium spadiceum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
